issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Hi all,

I am working with the nightly builds of eucalyptus 3.3 development version. Cloud has been successfully installed. But I am unable to login to User console. 

Please see the attached screenshot.

If you have any questions please do let me know.
fields.summary: unable to login to eucalyptus user console

comments.body:
I have created an account prabha
I have created user prabha with a password
I have generated keys and sourced the eucarc file but still it says failed to get access keys along with another error as No section:'paths'

Hi [~prabhav],

Please show your /etc/eucalyptus-console/console.ini file to us.
I have herewith attached the console.ini file

Hi deependra
  Thank you for your quick response.
 I have attached the console.ini file with this

Hi [~prabhav],

Thanks for sharing your console.ini file, it appears that your console.ini does not have the following section in the end

{code}
[paths]
staticpath: /usr/share/eucalyptus-console/static
{code}

Kindly append this information in console.ini and restart eucalyptus-console service, let us know if the error is still there.

Cheers!
Deependra
I have attached the screenshot after launching the user console

Dear Deependra
   
  After adding the path in console.ini..it lead to 4 more erros..whereelse all the values are already fixed in console.ini.I have attached 2 screenshots on the errors while launching the userconsole.
 Please do help me

Dear Deependra The mistake was mine.I included the path section in between server section..so I got the following error.Now it got solved.But still I cannot login into the userconsole due to boto server error The error is as follows WARNING 403 POST /autoscaling?Action=DescribeAutoScalingInstances (10.184.39.55) 3367.53ms 2013-04-11 18:17:45 ERROR BotoServerError: 403 Forbidden 403 ForbiddenFailed to find access keyFailed to find access key None 2013-04-11 18:17:45 WARNING 403 POST /autoscaling?Action=DescribeLaunchConfigurations (10.184.39.55) 3584.22ms 2013-04-11 18:17:45 ERROR BotoServerError: 403 Forbidden 403 ForbiddenFailed to find access keyFailed to find access key None 2013-04-11 18:17:45 WARNING 403 POST /autoscaling?Action=DescribeAutoScalingGroups (10.184.39.55) 3595.75ms 2013-04-11 18:17:45 ERROR BotoServerError: 403 Forbidden 403 ForbiddenFailed to find access keyFailed to find access key None

Dear Deependra
   Have you got any solution for me? I face the error only with the auto-scaling group.Is that the issue with aws webservice.Please do help me

The error is not because of that, it is because of a python libs missing or a configuration parameter missing in console.ini

Instead of sharing screenshots, share the file /var/log/messages having the errors in it.

Dear Deependra 
 I have attached all the cloud logs.
var-log-messages is only having 3 lines, please share complete file having the error you put in that screenshot earlier.

Actually I have only these three lines in the /var/log/messages.
I got the previous error in the screenshot while running launcher.sh
Do I have to enable any log file
Just look in /var/log/ the file name should be something like messages.1

Dear Deependra
 Have you got any solution for me

[~prabhav],
   Have you found a solution to your problem?  Are you really running Debian Squeeze (as the bug says) or on CentOS?

No Tim,
I am working with Debian wheezy.
But I downloaded the latest nightly build of eucalyptus and built it again.But now the error due to Boto has gone.But still I get the error while launching the userconsole

INFO 200 POST /ec2?Action=DescribeTags (10.184.39.55) 2.29ms
2013-04-29 10:23:47 ERROR 500 POST /autoscaling?Action=DescribeAutoScalingGroups (10.184.39.55) 9.47ms
2013-04-29 10:23:47 ERROR list index out of range

I have downloaded the loadbalancer image and uploaded in walrus.Based on this wiki page I have registered the loadbalancer image (https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/wiki/ELB-FAQ).After installing the lb image I have set system property of the load balancer image ID: euca-modify-property -p loadbalancing.loadbalancer_emi=

But I have given the bucket name as elb_image.Is it must to give the name as loadbalancer because in some other forum they have mentioned this naming could even cause errors.

Could you please explain me why I get this ERROR 500.What is the mistake I do

Prabha,
   You should get onto IRC to get some assistance (freenode.net, #eucalyptus).  
The first guess is there is a bug in describeAutoScalingGroups right now, but that's likely an out of range issue coming from python (either negative index or overshooting the array).  
    Note that the user console, for 3.3, won't have native support for Autoscaling (that'll come just after 3.3 releases).  Also I'm not sure what ELB will look like in the user console.  The User Console is just that, for users, and not really for admins.  It functions, but there are things that don't work right when logged in as an admin.
   Finally, creating your own LB VM can be tricky.  We're not, at this time, allowing custom built LB VM's (it will be provided by Eucalyptus).  However, it is possible to do so, but getting assistance on IRC will be the quickest way to make progress.   
   You should also try the command line for this and see if the problem persists.
